title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1725-2.4 - Disclosure of information
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1725-2.4 - Disclosure of information

State Regulations

Members of the board of directors have access to a
considerable amount of personal information concerning tenants or cooperators. Such information should be held in the strictest confidence and should not be
disclosed to any person except insofar as it has a direct bearing on: (a) the business of the company, or
(b) the division's efforts to
deter fraud in developments under its supervision, and except to persons duly
authorized to receive such information. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1725-2.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
